page.title: 10CHANGES IN WITHAM IN 20TH C.
page.content: 1919-1920 CRITTALL FACTORY Crittalls made metal windows.The first factory was in Braintree, and the second was set up in Witham. "The men came back from the War and went into Crittalls.." " You take the money I was earning at Crittalls-over Â£1 a day- well the average wage was about 15 to 18 bob outside, -he made Witham, didn't he, Crittall." Since 1945 Electrification of the railway cut down the journey time to London enabling people to go there to work. In 1928 the journey took about 80 minutes and only three trains left for London between 7 & 9 am.Now it takes about 45 minutes and 14 trains leave in that time.Estates at Moat farm and Dorothy Sayers Drive were built for Commuters.
